doc.name: config
doc.description:
WSForm should work out of the box.

As always there are exceptions and additions.

A config file is available for tweaking in case you run into troubles or want some extra features.

The config file should have already been added by the admin that installed WSForm and can be found in ../extensions/WSForm/config/config.php
doc.parameters:
use-api-user-only [default = "yes"][experimental]
The config setting user-api-user-only is a new feature as off 0.8.0.5.0. Default is set to yes (old WSForm behaviour) * If set to "no", WSForm will create/edit/upload under the current logged in user, instead of the WSForm user *. Even if set to no (leaving it empty also means yes), * WSForm still needs an API user for other tasks, so make sure you add a WSForm user

api-username

API username or BOT

api-password
API password or BOT password

is-bot
When using a BOT set "is-bot" to true to mark edits and page creations as done by a BOT

api-url-overrrule
WSForm will try to figure out where the api.php from MediaWiki can be found. If this doesn't work correctly you can enter the the API url here manually

api-cookie-path [default = '/tmp/CURLCOOKIE']
When sending API requests we need to set a cookie. If for some reason this does not work for you, try removing '/tmp/' and just leave "CURLCOOKIE"

wgAbsoluteWikiPath
is used when in a farm. Needs to be the path to the current wiki.
There it will look for WSFormSettings.php to read the username and password for that wiki user.

Example wgAbsoluteWikiPath :  $IP . '/wikis/' . $serverName

use-smtp

By default use-smtp is set to no, meaning it will use PHP Mail() functions. When set to yes, make sure you fill in all the other fields needed for SMTP. If you are in a Farm, please use WSFormSettings.php to setup SMTP on a farm.
All other SMTP fields are :

  • smtp-host
  • smtp-authentication
  • smtp-username
  • smtp-password
  • smtp-secure
  • smtp-port

wgScript
defaults to '/index.php' and is used for following a new created page. If your main wiki instalment is somewhere else, then set it here.

rc_site_key and rc_secret_key
If you want to use the Google Recaptcha, set rc_site_key and rc_secret_key. You receive this from Google when you sign-up

autosave-interval
When using autosave and autosave is set to auto or oninterval. This will be the interval time in milliseconds (30000 is 30 seconds) the form will be saved.

autosave-after-change
When using autosave and autosave is set to auto or onchange. This will be the time in milliseconds (3000 is 3 seconds) the form will be saved after the last change.

autosave-btn-on
When using autosave and autosave is set to auto or oninterval. This will be the text on the button above the form when interval is on.

autosave-btn-off
When using autosave and autosave is set to auto or oninterval. This will be the text on the button above the form when interval is off.

use-formbuilder
Defaults to true and shows the link to Formbuilder in the menus. Hide the link by changing the setting to false;

allow-edit-docs
If people with access to the documentation are allowed to edit them, defaults to false. Set to true to enable edit. Warning: When WSForm is updated by the administrator, all documentation that comes with WSForm will overwrite local made edits. Only custom new documentation will remain.

allow-special-page-setup
When set to true, the index.php/Special:WSForm/Setup allows for editing the config file from the Special page. Set to false to disable.

form-timeout-limit
As a security measure, WSForm will not allow a form to be submitted after a certain period of time (in seconds). Default is 7200 seconds meaning 2 hours.

sec (true or false - default : false (for compatibility)
If sec is set to true, security for WSForm is set to heavy. Filtering all inputs. Work in progress!

If you set sec to true, it is recommended to set sec-key. It is used as key/seed for encryption. Especially if you have multiple instances of your wiki running (AWS, Azure, etc), you must set sec-key in order for all containers/instances to work.

Filtering inputs is done using HTMLPurifier. Each input field will be filtered by default, but this can be adjusted.
Using sec, you can add an attribute to the input field called "html" with the following options:

  • html="all" : No filtering is done at all. So even JS injections are possible
  • html="nohtml" : No html allowed at all
  • html = "custom=b,u" : Only custom html attributes allowed, in this case, 
< u > and < b >
